keyPolicies.policyDescription: Expand free childcare to 25 hours a week for three and four-year-olds.
Freeze energy bills until 2017 and invest in energy efficiency, saving the average family £270 a year.
Protect our NHS with an extra £2.5 billion to create 20,000 more nurses, 8,000 more GPs, 5,000 more care workers, 3,300 more midwives and guarantee GP appointments within 48 hours.
Introduce a 10p tax rate to cut taxes for 24 million people and help middle and low-income earners.
Improve school standards by ensuring all teachers are qualified and transforming vocational education.

issues.health: Protect our NHS with an extra £2.5 billion to create 20,000 more nurses, 8,000 more GPs, 5,000 more care workers, 3,300 more midwives and guarantee GP appointments within 48 hours.

images.caption: Angela Rayner with local families and children.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Average wages are down by £1,600, while the cost of a nursery place has risen by 33 per cent, affecting family budgets. Seven out of ten stay-at-home mums say the cost of childcare has put them off looking for a job.
